  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.event.ContextClickEvent.ContextClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.LayoutEvents.LayoutClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.ComponentContainer, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents.ComponentAttachDetachNotifier, com.vaadin.ui.Layout, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.AlignmentHandler, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.MarginHandler, com.vaadin.ui.Layout.SpacingHandler, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<com.vaadin.ui.Component>

    public class DrugCart
extends com.vaadin.ui.HorizontalLayout
    Component implementing a cart for Drug entities to generate a DrugOrder entity. The component extends the vaadin HorizontalLayout component, so it can be used as part in any other vaadin container.
    Author:
    Michel Hosmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrugCart

        public DrugCart(Patient patient,
                DrugOrder order)
        Generates a DrugCart instance.
        Parameters:
        patient - optional parameter to set the patient to receive the order
        order - optional parameter to add items and remarks from an existing order to the cart

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(DrugOrderItem drugOrderItem)
        Adds an item to the cart. If the item is already present in the cart, its quantity will be increased by the corresponding amount
        Parameters:
        drugOrderItem - the item to be added to the cart

      • getItems

        public java.util.List<DrugOrderItem> getItems()
        Get a set of items that are currently in the cart.
        Returns:
        items in the cart

      • getNumberOfItems

        public int getNumberOfItems()
        Calculate the total amount of items in the cart (not just the number of different types)
        Returns:
        number of items in cart

      • emptyCart

        public void emptyCart()
        Clear all items that are currently in the cart

      • generateDrugOrder

        public DrugOrder generateDrugOrder()
        Generate a DrugOrder entity object from the items in the cart
        Returns:
        DrugOrder object generated from cart content. Returns null if the DrugOrder cannot be generated with the current cart content (no items or no patient selected)
